abstract_summ: Through scRNA-seq data analyses, we identified the organs at risk, such as lung, heart, esophagus, kidney, bladder, and ileum, and located specific cell types (i.e., type II alveolar cells (AT2), myocardial cells, proximal tubule cells of the kidney, ileum and esophagus epithelial cells, and bladder urothelial cells), which are vulnerable to 2019-nCoV infection.By way of using single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) technique, bladder cell clustering and ACE2 expression in various cell types were measured respectively.In the two mouse bladder samples, ACE2 expression of epithelial cells is 34.1%, also the highest of all cell types.Moreover, lung cells that have ACE2 expression may be the main target cells during 2019-nCoV infection.RESULTS: The results demonstrated that ACE2 is present in cardiomyocytes (CMs), endothelial cells, fibroblasts and smooth muscle cells in the heart, while the number of ACE2-postive (ACE2+) CMs and ACE2 gene expression in these CMs are significantly increased in the failing hearts.
title_summ: ScRNA-seq discover cell cluster change under OAB: ACE2 expression reveal possible alternation of 2019-nCoV infectious pathwayACE2 and TMPRSS2 expression by clinical, HLA, immune, and microbial correlates across 34 human cancers and matched normal tissues: implications for SARS-COV-2 COVID-19Bulk and single-cell transcriptomics identify tobacco-use disparity in lung gene expression of ACE2, the receptor of 2019-nCovSingle-cell RNA expression profiling of ACE2, the putative receptor of Wuhan 2019-nCoV, in the nasal tissueSingle-cell RNA-seq data analysis on the receptor ACE2 expression reveals the potential risk of different human organs vulnerable to 2019-nCoV infectionSingle-cell Transcriptome Analysis Indicates New Potential Regulation Mechanism of ACE2 and NPs signaling among heart failure patients infected with SARS-CoV-2High expression of ACE2 receptor of 2019-nCoV on the epithelial cells of oral mucosaThe digestive system is a potential route of 2019-nCov infection: a bioinformatics analysis based on single-cell transcriptomesSingle cell RNA sequencing of 13 human tissues identify cell types and receptors of human coronaviruses
title_abstract_phrases: By way of using single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) technique, bladder cell clustering and ACE2 expression in various cell types were measured respectively.These findings may advance our understanding of the underlying molecular mechanisms of myocarditis associated with COVID-19.High expression of ACE2 receptor of 2019-nCoV on the epithelial cells of oral mucosaIt has been reported that ACE2 is the main host cell receptor of 2019-nCoV and plays a crucial role in the entry of virus into the cell to cause the final infection.Through scRNA-seq data analyses, we identified the organs at risk, such as lung, heart, esophagus, kidney, bladder, and ileum, and located specific cell types (i.e., type II alveolar cells (AT2), myocardial cells, proximal tubule cells of the kidney, ileum and esophagus epithelial cells, and bladder urothelial cells), which are vulnerable to 2019-nCoV infection.In the two mouse bladder samples, ACE2 expression of epithelial cells is 34.1%, also the highest of all cell types.Moreover, lung cells that have ACE2 expression may be the main target cells during 2019-nCoV infection.
